department.dept_long_name: Committee on Degrees in Studies of Women, Gender, and Sexuality
department.dept_short_name: Studies of Women, Gender, and Sexuality

course.course_group: Studies of Women, Gender, and Sexuality
course.title: La Chicana: Race, Gender, and Mexican-American Identity
course.description: This course is an interdisciplinary exploration of the Chicana identities through feminist histories and scholarship. Beginning with a brief historical overview of Mexican American women in the U.S., we'll consider the emergence of Chicana feminism and examine the genesis of the term, "Chicana" as it was developed and deployed during El Movimiento in the early 1970's. Then move into contemporary explorations of identity including race, regional difference, art, literature, and community organizing. Course participants will gain the ability to recognize the interplay of social processes on the development of identity, especially within U.S. cultural institutions.
